question_sentence: Which of the following items was added to the basket of goods used by the UK's Office for National Statistics to measure inflation?
evidence: UK sales of vinyl have hit their highest level since 1990 as the revival of physical media accelerates. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: The prime minister of which country resigned as surging gang violence prevented their return from a trip abroad?
evidence: Prime Minister Ariel Henry agreed to resign after inaugurating a new interim governing council. Henry has been unable to return to Haiti since leaving in late January for visits to Guyana and Kenya, after gangs demanding his resignation attacked the airport and National Palace.

question_sentence: Which Welsh rugby legend announced his plan to retire after his country's final Six Nations match against Italy?
evidence: The third most capped player in Welsh rugby history announced his international retirement shortly after being named to face Italy this weekend. The 31-year-old will earn his 121st cap with Wales hoping not to finish bottom of the Six Nations table, but he faces a sunnier future playing in France for Provence from next season.

question_sentence: Tasmania's Premier Jeremy Rockliffpledged to build the world's biggest what if re-elected in the Australian state's upcoming election?
evidence: Rockliff has said that if returned to power in Tasmania's state election next week, his Liberal government will commit $12 million to create a "chocolate experience" that will also feature a chocolate studio, chocolate lab, chocolate emporium, a café and a playground.For more unusual news, subscribe to ourTall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Scientists this week revealed the discovery of more than 100 new deep-sea species off the coast of which country?
evidence: The mysterious creatures were found hidden in the remote 500-mile long Bounty Trough off the coast of New Zealand's South Island. The researchers exploring the largely unchartered waters told The New York Times that they expect to discover "hundreds" more new species.

question_sentence: A bill that could lead to a ban on TikTok in the US passed by how much in a House of Representatives vote?
evidence: The Senate will now vote on the bill, which would ban TikTok on national security grounds unless its Beijing-based owner, ByteDance, sells the app to a non-Chinese company.

question_sentence: Which suspended Conservative Party MP defected to Reform UK?
evidence: The former Tory party deputy chair announced on Monday that he was defecting to Reform UK (formerly the Brexit Party), becoming the right-wing populist party's first standing MP. Tory fears of a mass exodus of voters across the Red Wall in the north of England have been fuelled by Anderson's move.

question_sentence: The Pentagon this week authorised an emergency military aid package to Ukraine worth how much?
evidence: Announcing the military aid package, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivansaid the funding came from "unanticipated cost savings" in contracts to replace munitions sent to Ukraine. Additional funds for Kyiv remain blocked by Republican leaders in Congress.

question_sentence: Boris Johnson secretly flew where last month for unofficial talks with the country's leader, according to new reports?
evidence: The secret visit involved a meeting with sanctioned Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro, according to The Sunday Times. The UK does not recognise the legitimacy of the Maduro regime, but concerns are growing that the "oil-rich socialist republic" could supply weapons to its "close ally" Russia. For more international analysis, sign up to our Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: Which Democratic congressperson called for new elections in Israel?
evidence: The Senate majority leader claimed Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had "lost his way" by being "too willing" to tolerate the rising civilian death toll in Gaza. Schumer's call for a new election were met with immediate pushback from abroad and at home, with Israel's ruling Likud party and US Republicans Mitch McConnell and Mike Johnson accusing him of sowing division.

question_sentence: Which public figure is facing mounting speculation about her health and whereabouts?
evidence: Many are raising concerns about Catherine, Princess of Wales, and her extended absence from the public eye since the announcement of a planned abdominal surgery in January. She apologized this week for sparking confusion over an edited official photograph that was recalled by several international news agencies. (Image credit: Kin Cheung/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which movie swept several major awards at the Oscars, including wins for best picture and best director?
evidence: The movie “Oppenheimer” dominated the 2024 Oscars. The blockbuster won several top awards, including best picture, acting honors for Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey Jr., and best director for Christopher Nolan. (Image credit: Mike Blake/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which city is trying to manage a measles outbreak linked to a migrant shelter?
evidence: A CDC team arrived in Chicago this week to help officials respond to a measles outbreak linked to a migrant shelter. Local officials said the new measles cases are the first in the city since 2019. (Image credit: Erin Hooley/AP)

question_sentence: Which Caribbean nation‘s prime minister resigned this week as gangs run rampant through the country?
evidence: The embattled prime minister of Haiti, Ariel Henry, announced his resignation Tuesday as gangs in the country gain more power and the social order of the country threatens to collapse. (Image credit: Odelyn Joseph/AP/File)

question_sentence: Which state’s government scrambled to defend its computer systems this week following a pair of cyber incidents?
evidence: While there was no data stolen in the incident, several Alabama officials faced intermittent “disruptions” from hackers half a world away. (Image credit: boonchai wedmakawand/Moment RF/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which social media platform is one step closer to being banned in the United States after the House passed a controversial bill this week?
evidence: The House passed a bill Wednesday that could lead to a US ban of TikTok. The legislation now heads to the Senate. (Image credit: Will Lanzoni/CNN)

question_sentence: Who clinched the Republican presidential nomination Tuesday?
evidence: The rematch is set between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump after the two rivals earned enough delegates Tuesday to win their parties’ presidential nominations. (Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which city recently unveiled new measures to crack down on raucous spring breakers?
evidence: Miami authorities announced hefty fines, curfews, bag checks, restricted beach access and DUI checkpoints in response to disturbances and crime tied to spring breakers. (Image credit: Marta Lavandier/AP)

question_sentence: Which new product at Trader Joe’s sparked a frenzy after going viral on social media?
evidence: A Trader Joe’s mini tote bag that costs $2.99 is being resold online for nearly 200 times its retail price. (Image credit: Stephen Zenner/SOPA Images/LightRocket/Getty Images)

question_sentence: How many cups of coffee does the average adult drink daily?
evidence: The average American adult drinks over three cups daily, according to the National Coffee Association. In some extreme cases, however, scientists say overconsumption of caffeine can lead to a state called caffeine intoxication or caffeine overdose. (Image credit: Oleg Breslavtsev/Moment RF/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Why is Thomas Caffrey, a former Milford School District employee, wanted by the police?
choices: He was involved in a physical altercation at the school.
He failed to report for duty.

question_sentence: Which cast members of the sitcom “Good Times” are expected to attend the 50th anniversary celebration in Delaware?
choices: Jimmie Walker and Bern Nadette Stanis

question_sentence: Why is a controlled burn planned for Brandywine Creek State Park?
choices: To clear the park for new construction
To prepare for a large public event

question_sentence: Who was the standout player in Dover’s victory over Salesianum in the DIAA Boys Basketball Tournament championship game?
What is the name of the beer released by Dogfish Head Brewery in collaboration with the Delaware Restaurant Association to celebrate Women’s History Month in 2024?
What was the name of the Delaware restaurant that was known for its seasonal muskrat dinners for more than 40 years?
What is happening to the AMC movie theater?
choices: The AMC movie theater is being renovated.
The AMC movie theater is planning to close.
The AMC movie theater is hosting the Oscars.

question_sentence: What is the proposed tax by the city of Newark on gross rental receipts?
What was the purpose of the referendum proposed by the Smyrna School District?
choices: To reduce the school district’s budget
To decrease taxes for the residents of Smyrna
To build a new sports complex for the district

question_sentence: What is the proposed change in the draft budget for next year to the Purchase of Care program in Delaware?
choices: The family eligibility would be expanded to 150% of the federal poverty level.
The family eligibility would be expanded to 250% of the federal poverty level.
The family eligibility would be expanded to 200% of the federal poverty level.
